Legumes are harvested when they are dried out by the sun. Then they are further processed into other products like canned beans. The extra cooking and packaging give canned beans a slightly higher footprint, but itâ€™s minimal compared to the impact of meat and dairy.

answerExplanation.text:
Cereals like pasta, rice, and bread are the most important energy source for humanity because of their carbs. But they also contain a lot more protein than you think.

These products - especially the whole grain version - are essential for a sustainable diet because they make us less dependent on protein from meat and dairy.

Both oats (14g) and wheat (12g) are high in protein and that means that bread has more protein than beans (ca. 8g per 100 g). Rice is around the same level as beans.

So while beans are a great source of protein (and fiber), grain products often provide most of the protein in a meal!

Fear puts our body into survival mode: more adrenaline and less creative and rational thinking. Thatâ€™s useful for running away from a tiger but not for changing a habit, which can also be scary.
